benchmark_details.name: CCNewsPDD
benchmark_details.overview: CCNewsPDD is a temporally unbiased benchmark for evaluating the Pre-Training Data Detection (PDD) task, employing rigorous data transformations to ensure consistent time distributions between training and non-training data.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To develop a reliable benchmark for detecting pre-training data in large language models using neuronal activation patterns.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: NA-PDD requires access to model weights and activation information, making it unsuitable for closed-source models.

data.source: CCNews corpus with data transformations including back translation, masking, and LLM rewriting.

methodology.calculation: AUC is calculated based on the ratio of member neuron activation to non-member neuron activation for given data inputs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher AUC indicates better performance in detecting whether specific data was part of the training corpus.
methodology.baseline_results: NA-PDD significantly outperformed existing methods, achieving an AUC of 99.7% on CCNewsPDD.
methodology.validation: Evaluated across three benchmark datasets with a focus on eliminating time drift confounding effects.
